parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To send up (to a higher tribunal), send back. From ana and pempo; to send up or back.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Compound of heros and eidos; heroic; Herod, the name of four Jewish kings.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
